Comment 3: 
Can't main packages be imported?  Then there would be an inconsistency between the
PkgPath reported when it is built as a command vs when it is imported into another
package.

PkgPath is meant to ensure the uniqueness of identifiers.  "main" doesn't ensure this;
only the true package path can.  Two different main packages might think they are
talking about the same field/method/type (e.g., via some serialization library) when in
reality they are not.

I guess it's not a big deal.  If not in Go1, at least Go2?
